title: GISRUK 2024 : University of Leeds
text:
Welcome to the 32nd Annual GIS Research UK Conference. The conference will be hosted at University of Leeds on 9th – 12th April 2024.
GISRUK attracts international researchers and practitioners in GIS and related fields to share and discuss the latest advances in spatial computing and analysis. The work presented at GISRUK covers a range of methodological approaches and application areas, including: geographic data science, geocomputation, applied statistics, geography, health, urban and transport planning, crime science.
We welcome papers covering all aspects of GIS, both methodological and applied. There is also a theme for the 2024 conference – GIS for public good: data, theory, policy – around which keynotes and other activity will be structured.
See the Call for papers for details on how to submit.

title: Call for Papers
text:
We are pleased to invite 1500-word extended abstracts for the 32nd Annual GISRUK Conference, to be held 9th – 12th April 2024 at the University of Leeds. The deadline is 7th November 2023 and submission is via EasyChair (details to follow).
Work presented at GISRUK covers a range of methodological approaches and application areas. We are particularly interested in papers that align with the conference theme – GIS for public good: data, theory, policy – but below is a non-exhaustive list of typical focuses:
Data/Methods

Spatial statistics
Agent-based models
Open data and code
Reproducibility and inference
Uncertainty quantification and analysis
Machine learning and AI
Data visualization and communication

Application areas

transportation and land use
environment and sustainability
health, neighbourhoods and housing
crime analysis
labour markets and economic geography

Submitted abstracts will be assessed by at least two members from the GISRUK 2024 Scientific Committee and selected papers invited for full journal publication as a Special Issue (details to follow).

Guidelines

Submissions should be extended abstracts of no more than 1500 words.
Absrtacts should be prepared using one of these templates (MS Word, LaTeX, Quarto).

All abstracts will be subject to peer review and allocated to short or long presentations, or poster presentations.
Authors should make efforts towards enabling reproducibility of their work, where possible. GISRUK do not produce specific guidance, but authors may wish to consult relevant documentation from organisations such as AGILE.
Any queries can be directed to Roger Beecham: r.j.beecham@leeds.ac.uk.

title: GISRUK 2024 : University of Leeds
text:
Key Dates

Paper submission deadline: early-mid November 2023 (deadline TBC)
Paper review notifications: early-mid Jan 2024 (deadline TBC)
Registration opens: December 2023
ECR workshops: 9th-10th April 2024
Conference: 10th-12th April 2024

title: Organisation
text:
GISRUK2024 is hosted by the School of Geography, University of Leeds. We have assembled a local organising committee:

Roger Beecham and Will James, School of Geography. Joint conference leads
Arjan Gosal, School of Geography.
Nick Hood, School of Geography.
Vikki Houlden, School of Geography.
Rachel Oldroyd, School of Geography.
Fran Pontin, Leeds Institute for Data Analytics.
Kieran Suchack, Institute for Transport Studies.
